turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: It's going to be all right, Jake. It's going to be all right. Don't be afraid. I've got you now.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Hold me, Jezzie. Hold me.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Why won't you answer me?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Cause you know goddamn well who I am.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I don't know you.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: You've lived with me for two years.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: That doesn't mean shit. Where do you come from, huh? And I don't mean Indiana.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: What do you want me to say? My mother's tummy?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: You know goddamn well what I mean.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: You're out of your fucking mind. I'm not gonna stand around here gettin' interrogated by you.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Well leave then. Go to Hell.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: You son-of-a-bitch. Who do you think you are? I don't deserve this. Who takes care of you day and night? Who cleans the floor and washes your goddamn underwear? Well, I've had it. You flip out on your own, you ungrateful bastard. I'm done holding your hand. I don't want anything to do with you, you hear? Nothing!

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: What'd you do that for? It's an in- teresting story. All these people are still disappearing. Right off the street.  Hey, what's wrong? Are you all right?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I'm okay. I just don't want to lis- ten.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: You look upset.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I'm not upset.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Jake, what is it?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I'm tired.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: You look terrible. What happened?  Jake ... is it the antidote?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Goddamn it. Why do you say that?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Look at yourself. You look like you've seen a ghost.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Shit! Can't I just have a bad day?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: You can have anything you want.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Then don't bug me.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: I'm not bugging you. Come and lie down. I'll give you a massage.  Where'd you go today?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Mid-town mostly.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Oh yeah? What was happenin' there?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I picked up my ticket.  I'm leaving in the morning, Jez.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Oh?  Where you going?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: West.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Where's West? New Jersey?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Don't be funny.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: I always liked the West, west of Il- linois anyway. But you gotta give me time to pack.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Stop it, Jez. Don't do that.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Do what? I haven't done a thing.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Don't play games with me. There's nothing more to say.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Where's Sarah? Where are the boys?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Sit down, Jake.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Where are they?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Sit down!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No! What's going on? Where's my family?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: It's over, Jake. It's all over.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Where have they gone?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Wake up! Stop playing with yourself. It's finished.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: This isn't happening.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Your capacity for self-delusion is remarkable, Dr. Singer.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Oh God!

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: What's wrong, Jake?  Forget to take your antidote?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Goddamn you!

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: I loved your chemist, Jake. The height of fantasy. And your vision of paradise.  A most romantic creation. You're quite a dreamer, Jake. Only it's time to wake up.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: WHO ARE YOU?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: How many times have you asked me that? How many times?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: TELL ME, DAMN YOU!

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: You know who I am.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Surprised, huh? I told you you'd know me. I've been tracking you for a long time. I just wish I'd spoken to you before tonight.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I don't get it. Who are you? Why have you been following me?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Observation, mainly. Clinical study. You were one of the survivors.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: So first I'm arrested, right? Best LSD I ever made, right down the drain. I figure this is it, twenty years in the joint, if I'm lucky. That was '68.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Long time ago.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Next thing I know I'm on Rikers Island. Ever been there?  Suddenly they take me from my cell to the visitors room with those bank teller windows, you know. Four army colonels, medals up their asses, are standing on the other side. They tell me if I'll come to Vietnam for two years, no action, mind you, just work in a lab, they'll drop all the charges and wipe the record clean. Well, I'd only been in jail for thirteen hours and I already knew that Nam couldn't be any worse.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Shows how much you knew.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No shit. They had me by the balls. Next thing I know I'm in Saigon ... in a secret lab synthesizing mind- altering drugs. Not the street stuff mind you. They had us isolating special properties. The dark side, you know? They wanted a drug that increased aggressive tendencies.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Yeah, sure. We were losing the war.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Right. They were worried. They figured you guys were too soft. They wanted something to stir you up, tap into your anger, you know? And we did it. The most powerful thing I ever saw. Even a bad trip, and I had my share, never compared to the fury of the Ladder.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: The Ladder?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: That's what they called it. A fast trip right down the ladder.  Right to the primal fear, the base anger. I'm tellin' you, it was powerful stuff. But I don't need to tell you. You know.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Anyway, this big offensive was coming up. Everyone knew it; Time Magazine, Huntley-Brinkley. And the brass was scared 'cause they knew we couldn't win. Morale was down. It was gettin' ugly in the States. Hell, you remember.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Like it was yesterday.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: A couple days later they decided to use the Ladder, on one test battalion. Yours. Just in an infintessimal dose in the food supply, to prove its effectiveness in the field. They were sure your unit would have the highest kill ratio in the whole goddamn offensive. And you did, too. But not the way they tnought.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: None of us can remember that night. I get flashes of it but they don't make sense. We saw shrinks for years. But nothing they did could ever touch it. What happened? Was there ever an offensive?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: A couple of days later. It was fierce. You guys never saw it.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: But there was an attack. I can still see them coming. There was a fight, wasn't there?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Yeah. But not with the Cong.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Who then?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I always suspected the effects might come back. That's why I had to follow you. I had a hell of a time getting hold of your records.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: If you knew, why didn't you say anything?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: The truth can kill, my friend. Five hundred men died out there. This isn't a story they'd ever want out. When Paul's car blew up I realized the scope of the thing. I knew they meant business.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: So why tell me now?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Because I can get rid of the demons. I can block the Ladder. I have an antidote. We can kill them off, chemically speaking. They'll all disappear. It's chemistry, my friend. I know. I created it. Come with me. I can help.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: You come here often?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Sometimes. When it's convenient.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: How do I know this isn't just some kind of, you know, seduction or something?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Hey, I'm not the problem. You've got bigger problems than me.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I came up with the formula back in Nam but I never got a chance to use it.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Never?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'd hoped I'd never have to. Just open your mouth and stick out your tongue.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Don't worry. Take it. It'll free your head. Come on.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: "Yea though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death I shall fear no evil," but no one ever said I wouldn't be shittin' in my pants every step of the way, huh?  Stick out your tongue.  That'a boy. Now why don't you just lie down and relax.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: One drop?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It's strong stuff.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I think I'm falling asleep.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Pleasant dreams.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I can't move.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Just relax.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What's happening? Help me.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: And no more demons. I told you they'd be gone.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I don't believe this. It's a miracle, Michael. A miracle.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Better living through chemistry, that's my motto.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: It was paradise, Michael. You showed it to me. You were there.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Well that's good to know.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Mike, it was real. It was glorious.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Glorious. I'm not surprised. I fed you enough of that stuff to send a horse to heaven. I'm just glad you came back.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I would have stayed there if I could.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'm sure. You've got nothing but troubles waitin' for you here.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Here. I've got every credit card ever printed. Take this. Stay here till you can arrange to get away. It's on me.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No. I couldn't.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What? You want the Plaza? Don't be foolish. Here. Take this, too.  This is my place on Prince Street. It's got my phone, everything. Call if you need me ... but you won't. Everything's gonna work out. You just get outta town as fast as you can. The New York police can be effective when they want to be.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I don't know what to say.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Save the words ... Just send back my credit card.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Excuse me, do you know if we've passed Nostrand Avenue yet?  Excuse me.  Look, I'm asking a simple question. Have we hit Nostrand Avenue? I fell asleep.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: I no from around here.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Yeah, you and everyone else.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: How 'bout over there?  No wait. Do me a favor. Bring 'em to the back room.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: They're awfully heavy.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: I know. That's why I'm asking.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Where's Wong?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: That's what I'd like to know. If you see him on the street somewhere, tell him he's fired.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: How was Palm Springs?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Hot. Where do I sign?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: You got a nice tan, though.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Tan? What tan? It faded on the airplane. I'd try to get my money back, but who do you ask?  Two hundred dollars a night, for what?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No. I'll take the other one.  Right. Well it's good to have you back. See you tomorrow, probably.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: If you're lucky.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: He's burning up.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Total delirium.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: That's some gash. His guts keep spilling out.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Push 'em back.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Help me!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Throw that torch away, young man. Give yourself up. You're under arrest.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: For what? For seeking the truth?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Please come quietly.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: You come near me and I'll blow us all up.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: We're not going to hurt you.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Clear the area. This is an order!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What is wrong with you?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Dream on!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: He's burning up.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Total delirium.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: He'll never make it.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: That's some gash. His guts keep spilling out.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Push 'em back.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Help me!

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: I'll page him.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Call my chiropractor.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: We're doing everything we can.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Louis Schwartz. Nostrand Avenue.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: Well, don't we look better this morning? That was a hard night, wasn't it?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Where am I?

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: Lennox Hospital.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I'm awake?

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: You look awake to me. Here.  Drink some of this.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Where's Sarah? Where did she go?  She was here ...

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: No. No. You haven't had any visitors.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: That's a lie. My family was here.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Last night! They were as real as you are!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: This is not a dream! This is my life.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: Of course it is. What else could it be?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Jacob Singer?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Speaking.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Paul Gruneger!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Paul Gruneger! Well I'll be goddamned!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Paul! You son-of-a-bitch, how the hell are you? I haven't seen you in what, five, six, years?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: A long time.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Jesus Christ. How've you been? What's happening in your life?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Nothin' much.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Me neither. Nothing too exciting. So tell me, to what do I owe the honor?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I need to see you, Jake.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Shit, Paul. I'd love to see you. But I'm kind of laid up here. I've been sick.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I need to see you.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Jesus, man, you look terrific. You must have put on twenty pounds.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I work in a bakery.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: You're lucky. How many vets you know are even employed?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Count 'em on one hand.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: It's almost like a conspiracy, huh?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: No joke. Fuckin' army! That goddamn war. I'm still fightin' it.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: It's not worth it. You'll never win.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You tellin' me? How many times can you die, huh?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Still married, Jake?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You and everybody else. God I hate this area. Makes me nervous.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Why the hell we drivin' here?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I just need to talk.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: You can't talk in Brownsville?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I'm not sure where I can talk anymore.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Let's get a couple drinks, okay?  Hey, take a look behind us. Do you think that car is followin' us?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: That black car?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Pull the mirror down on the sun visor.  Just watch 'em.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What's goin' on Paul?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: You in trouble?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: That's as straight as I can put it. And don't tell me that I'm crazy 'cause I know I'm not. I'm goin' to Hell. They're comin' after me.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Who is?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: They've been followin' me. They're comin' outta the walls. I don't trust anyone. I'm not even sure I trust you. But I gotta talk to someone. I'm gonna fly outta my fuckin' mind.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Sorry. Sometimes I think I'm just gonna jump outta my skin. They're just drivin' me wild.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Who, Paul? What exactly ... ?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I don't know who they are, or what they are. But they're gonna get me and I'm scared, Jake. I'm so scared I can't do anything. I can't go to my sisters. I can't even go home.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: They're waitin' for me, that's why.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: It's okay, Paul. It's okay.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I don't know what to do.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Don't do anything.  Paul, I know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I've seen them too ... the demons!

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You've seen them?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Everywhere, like a plague.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: God almighty. I thought I was the only one.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Me, too. I had no idea. It's like I was coming apart at the seams.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Oh God. I know. I know.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What is it Paul? What's happening to me?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: They keep telling me I'm already dead, that they're gonna tear me apart, piece by piece, and throw me into the fire.  I carry these everywhere but they don't help. Nothing helps. Everyone thinks I'm crazy. My mother filed a report with the army.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: The army?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: She said I haven't been the same since then. Since that night. There's still this big hole in my brain. It's so dark in there, Jake. And these creatures. It's like they're crawling out of my brain. What happened that night? Why won't they tell us?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I don't know. I don't know.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: They're monsters, Jake. We're both seein' 'em. There's gotta be a connection. Something.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I'm afraid to go by myself anymore. I keep thinkin' one of 'em's gonna come up behind me. Somethin's wrong when a guy can't even take a leak by himself. I've seen 'em take people right off the street. I used to go home a different way every night. Now I can't even go home.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: You come home with me.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What about your girlfriend? You don't think she'll mind?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Are you kidding? We've put up more of her cousins. You wouldn't believe how they breed down there.

turns.speaker: LEADER
turns.text: Can I help you?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I'm looking for Dr. Carlson. Isn't this his office?

turns.speaker: LEADER
turns.text: I'm so sorry. Obviously you haven't ... Dr. Carlson died.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Died?

turns.speaker: LEADER
turns.text: A car accident.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Jesus, Jesus! ... When?

turns.speaker: LEADER
turns.text: Last month, before Thanksgiving.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: How did it happen?

turns.speaker: LEADER
turns.text: No one knows. They say it blew up.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Blew up? What do you mean it blew up?

turns.speaker: LEADER
turns.text: Do you want me to get someone?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No. No. It's okay. I'm okay.

turns.speaker: MRS. CARMICHAEL
turns.text: I have some ice from the machine.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Bring it in.

turns.speaker: MRS. CARMICHAEL
turns.text: Is he all right?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: He doesn't like it.

turns.speaker: MRS. CARMICHAEL
turns.text: I don't blame him. What should I do with the ice?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Pour it in.

turns.speaker: MRS. CARMICHAEL
turns.text: On top of him?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: He's melting it as fast as we dump it in.

turns.speaker: MRS. CARMICHAEL
turns.text: Okay. My husband's got two more bags. He's coming. They're heavy.

turns.speaker: AZRAEL
turns.text: Watch it punk, I'm armed.

turns.speaker: DALLAS
turns.text: Punk?

turns.speaker: DALLAS
turns.text: That's nine to four, geek-boy.

turns.speaker: AZRAEL
turns.text: You got lucky.

turns.speaker: DALLAS
turns.text: You got lucky. I could have waited until he ate your head.

turns.speaker: AZRAEL
turns.text: Speaking of which, duck!

turns.speaker: DALLAS
turns.text: That sucks. Why won't he go down?

turns.speaker: AZRAEL
turns.text: Pause play.

turns.speaker: DALLAS
turns.text: He's not part of the program.

turns.speaker: AZRAEL
turns.text: Hey cool. They brought ancient hockey guy back to life.

turns.speaker: AZRAEL
turns.text: Asshole that does not count as a kill.

turns.speaker: DALLAS
turns.text: Yes it does.

turns.speaker: AZRAEL
turns.text: Oh, come on!

turns.speaker: DALLAS
turns.text: Okay, enough of this shit.

turns.speaker: AZRAEL
turns.text: Alright, asshole.

turns.speaker: DALLAS
turns.text: I don't have all day, kid.

turns.speaker: AZRAEL
turns.text: Yeah yeah I better call the labs, see what the hell is going on.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Duck fuckers?

turns.speaker: RIZZO
turns.text: He's either unconcious or playing dead, whichever, he ain't really dead. Okay, you know , that's it for me. I'm outta here.

turns.speaker: RIZZO
turns.text: Forget the bridge, the shuttle's waiting!

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: What do you mean, not enough time?

turns.speaker: RIZZO
turns.text: Just make a break for the door. He'll get some of us, but that's the breaks.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: We're not leaving Crutch!

turns.speaker: RIZZO
turns.text: We don't have time to argue!

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Goodbye old friend.

turns.speaker: RIZZO
turns.text: Okay, he was a great guy, now let's move out.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Could you show a little compassion?!

turns.speaker: RIZZO
turns.text: It's locked!

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Then break it! If you don't pull it, the ship's going to depressurize!

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: What are you doing?!!

turns.speaker: RIZZO
turns.text: If the ship goes, so does Jaso.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Rizzo pull the fucking lever!

turns.speaker: RIZZO
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: RIZZO
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: THat's the sound of deep space attacking the integrity of the ship.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: When the left hull goes, so will the right.

turns.speaker: RIZZO
turns.text: What if we blow the walkways first? Leave Jason over here to go up with the ship?

turns.speaker: RIZZO
turns.text: We can't lead him into the other hull!

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: We don't have a choice!

turns.speaker: RIZZO
turns.text: Can we blow it with just two?

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: If we don't sever the hull completely she'll drag us down with her.

turns.speaker: RIZZO
turns.text: His mother?

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RIZZO
turns.text: I don't know. Nothing.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Minimal.

turns.speaker: RIZZO
turns.text: We made it?

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: The ship's depressurizing, the engines overheating. When it  reaches the core, we're done.

turns.speaker: RIZZO
turns.text: Done?

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Hurry up, guys. We've got the rescue ship on radar.

turns.speaker: RIZZO
turns.text: Delongpre! Out of time!

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Remember, stay calm, use your thrusters. We'll be fine.

turns.speaker: RIZZO
turns.text: Why wouldn't we be. I mean, look around. So far so good.

turns.speaker: BRODSKI
turns.text: Damnit to hell, you left me back there to die!

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Sergeant? We thought you were...

turns.speaker: BRODSKI
turns.text: Yeah, yeah.  Well, what have you got to say for yourself?

turns.speaker: BRODSKI
turns.text: Bomb?

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Explosive. We're blowing the walkway.

turns.speaker: BRODSKI
turns.text: Blowing the walkway? You come up with that yourself?

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Rizzo did.

turns.speaker: BRODSKI
turns.text: Can't shut em' down from here.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Somebody's gonna have to go back to the engine room.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Sergeant!

turns.speaker: BRODSKI
turns.text: Get out of here!

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Uh-oh.

turns.speaker: JANESSA
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Kkinsa! Open the doors!

turns.speaker: JANESSA
turns.text: Okay that hurt.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Thorgan, pull us in.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Where have you been?!!

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Where the hell were you?!!

turns.speaker: JANESSA
turns.text: He came for me, I had to run!

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Creepy.

turns.speaker: THORGAN
turns.text: Cool.

turns.speaker: THORGAN
turns.text: Nice touch.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: And you said high school was boring.

turns.speaker: THORGAN
turns.text: You see that?

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Briggs, Geko, movement beyond the boxed fuselage.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Better let me.

turns.speaker: THORGAN
turns.text: Where'd you get the gun?

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Everyone okay?

turns.speaker: THORGAN
turns.text: I think I broke my arm.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Shit!

turns.speaker: THORGAN
turns.text: The hull's imploding!

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Rizzo! Can you hear me?!

turns.speaker: THORGAN
turns.text: We're not supposed to do that.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: What are you gonna do, tell me?

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: I'll need system four converters.

turns.speaker: THORGAN
turns.text: They're back here.

turns.speaker: THORGAN
turns.text: Hey! I'm not ready.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Then you better hurry. I'll blow alley one, Delongpre, you and Rizzo take there. Janessa you ready two and we'll meet up there.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Thorgan, quit screwing around and come on!

turns.speaker: THORGAN
turns.text: I'm coming, I'm coming.

turns.speaker: THORGAN
turns.text: Kay-Em!

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: What are you doing back?!!

turns.speaker: THORGAN
turns.text: As long as they're connected we can blow them all simultaneously from a safe distance.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Two more charges to go.

turns.speaker: THORGAN
turns.text: Done!

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Let's move out!

turns.speaker: THORGAN
turns.text: Goodbye, my love.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Thorgan, suit up.

turns.speaker: THORGAN
turns.text: This is gonna work. If he sticks to the program. Will he? Stick to the program?

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Brodski! Get to Lab two. We have an emergency!

turns.speaker: DELONGPRE
turns.text: Er, guys. Where's the Hockey Player?

turns.speaker: DELONGPRE
turns.text: We'd need charges.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: We could convert fission transistors.

turns.speaker: DELONGPRE
turns.text: How many?

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Bring 'em all. Let's move!

turns.speaker: DELONGPRE
turns.text: I think I speak on behalf of the group when I say this is bad news.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Thorgan? You coming?!

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Where is...?

turns.speaker: DELONGPRE
turns.text: You tell me! She's only set one charge. And it's not finished!

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: I'd say we have about ten minutes tops.

turns.speaker: DELONGPRE
turns.text: Then stop talking and work faster!

turns.speaker: DELONGPRE
turns.text: Then what do we do?!

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: I don't know!

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Hurry!

turns.speaker: DELONGPRE
turns.text: Faster! Don't we have another gun?

turns.speaker: DELONGPRE
turns.text: It bought us some time.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: And now we're all out of it.

turns.speaker: DELONGPRE
turns.text: Earth II.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Suit up.

turns.speaker: DELONGPRE
turns.text: Boeman, the ships not here.

turns.speaker: BOEMAN
turns.text: Use the thrusters and you'll be fine. We'll huddle together out there.

turns.speaker: DELONGPRE
turns.text: Hey, easy now.
